Tom Emerson wrote:

>Here is a patch to ReplayCharSequenceFactory#isMultibyteEncoding
>that adds recognition for another Shift JIS name variant and Korea's
>KSC-5601.
>
>Share and enjoy.
>
>
>
>Index: src/java/org/archive/io/ReplayCharSequenceFactory.java
>===================================================================
>RCS file: /cvsroot/archive-crawler/ArchiveOpenCrawler/src/java/org/archive/io/ReplayCharSequenceFactory.java,v
>retrieving revision 1.26
>diff -c -r1.26 ReplayCharSequenceFactory.java
>*** src/java/org/archive/io/ReplayCharSequenceFactory.java	30 Jun 2004 23:59:50 -0000	1.26
>--- src/java/org/archive/io/ReplayCharSequenceFactory.java	26 Jul 2004 19:20:23 -0000
>***************
>*** 180,185 ****
>--- 180,186 ----
>                      encodingLowerCase.startsWith("xeuc")        ||
>                      encodingLowerCase.startsWith("shift")       ||
>                      encodingLowerCase.startsWith("sjis")        ||
>+                     encodingLowerCase.startsWith("x-sjis")      ||
>                      encodingLowerCase.startsWith("iso2022")     ||
>                      encodingLowerCase.startsWith("windows31")   ||
>                      encodingLowerCase.startsWith("big5")        ||
>***************
>*** 191,196 ****
>--- 192,198 ----
>                      encodingLowerCase.startsWith("cp10")        ||
>                      encodingLowerCase.startsWith("gb180")       ||
>                      encodingLowerCase.startsWith("gbk")         ||
>+                     encodingLowerCase.startsWith("ksc_56")      ||
>                      encodingLowerCase.startsWith("iscii") ) {
>  
>                      isMultibyte = true;
>
>
>  
>
